channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: I guess you could say that I‚Äôm reading @midlifebook. https://t.co/WjQ7Hw02Hf

A sampling from @winterstations 2022. https://t.co/bV2zJEziaF
https://t.co/FUcZaFl6VT
Happy Toronto Day, everybody! https://t.co/luQnT2jD0M
@gaminginthewild I started playing Fe again yesterday. (I had a saved game before I started, so I must have played it once before.) Really beautiful so far.

I‚Äôm seeing couples argue on the street and I‚Äôm saying, hopefully within earshot, ‚ÄúListen to her!‚Äù and ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt matter so much what happened in the past, figure out what to do in the future!‚Äù Nature is healing.
When he said to her ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be a fucking idiot‚Äù I laughed out loud, trying to make the point of ‚ÄúDid you seriously just say that to her?‚Äù I didn‚Äôt go beyond the laugh because, I don‚Äôt know, maybe she likes being talked to that way. I doubt it, though.
@CatherineOmega https://t.co/ApeHr3if7y

This afternoon. https://t.co/dMWntm7BVE
I couldn‚Äôt find ‚ÄúRichard‚Äù in this gallery of whales who‚Äôve been given names by researchers. #ROMGreatWhales https://t.co/lc4H1QIKTq
People tell me that I have a big heart, but I can assure you, it‚Äôs not as big as this whale heart. #ROMGreatWhales https://t.co/CaQ0BqxBIE
It was all stuff I‚Äôd seen before, and wanted to see again, but it didn‚Äôt feel worth $40 this time. Maybe because it was because I didn't have someone to go with.
The ROM isn‚Äôt for me. The AGO is more my size, and the Museum of Contemporary Art Toronto Canada (that‚Äôs a mouthful) is probably more my style. I miss the Museum of Vancouver. That‚Äôs definitely both my size and my style.
https://t.co/Tr0GiCmS3b
I‚Äôm playing Fe for the next hour or so. https://t.co/xC6O8hiEJA
Here‚Äôs a sight for sore eyes. https://t.co/uEwudtELpa

I bought a print. https://t.co/06bLciOzYF
(I gave serious thought to buying the original.)
@ReneeStephen As a celebration, I‚ÄôM CRUSHING YOUR HEAD! https://t.co/O49ArqOHnk
Any reason why Moe Sihota doesn‚Äôt have an Order of B.C. yet? https://t.co/WugW9gV1aZ
I can‚Äôt help but notice that Nardwuar the Human Serviette is not on the list. https://t.co/WugW9gV1aZ
@daringfireball Of what year?
Oh my goodness. https://t.co/THEymVZkzd
üé∂ ‚ÄúAll caught up in the reverie / Every word is a symphony‚Äù üé∂ https://t.co/FMwPSPvqfH
*Owen Wilson Wow* https://t.co/6UxQXXQFdj
@jeffjedras I immediately thought ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs running!‚Äù when I saw that news. I wonder how his French is these days.
It‚Äôs been interesting to watch China trying to thread the needle with regards to the situation in Ukraine. https://t.co/xc9P2AcwMW
@adamrg As a Canadian‚Ä¶ https://t.co/7sAJSOTTmt

I‚Äôm having a pretty good day so far.
My day continues to go pretty well.
Today‚Äôs been a pretty good day, too.
I got more or less what I wanted out of today.
Yesterday was pretty good. Today is starting off well.
@nmebrown This game is my aesthetic.

We set a world record! Here‚Äôs the recap of the operation I participated in to create a 14-level homogenous field over Toronto. #Ingress https://t.co/bEERIozXz9
My photo of the treacherous icy path I took to visit a portal during the operation made the cut. It was truly unanticipated (it wasn‚Äôt like that in my reconnaissance the week prior), and where I ended up was perilous, too. I caught myself worrying that be left for dead. https://t.co/PX7YZ5Lpoh
I find it really funny, on multiple levels, that the author of the post recapping the record-setting homogenous field highlighted me deploying a resonator at the portal named The Ministry of Silly Walks while at the bar for celebratory drinks. #Ingress https://t.co/Fwb4fG9nSb
@toddsieling A parody account pressed Save, apparently. https://t.co/3wsCHjfXqG
Is there a Wikipedia page for sanctions against Russia by businesses? I found one for states, but not *Hank Hill shudder* non-state actors. https://t.co/T9oRMLD824
